It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in coastal areas and damp forests. The serrated leaves and prickly fruits make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
